title: Live stream Copa America Femenina final free online today | Colombia vs . Brazil
body_text:
QUITO, Ecuador – The stage is set for a dramatic showdown, as Colombia faces defending champions Brazil in the 2025 Copa América Femenina final on Saturday, Aug. 2, at the Rodrigo Paz Delgado Stadium in Quito, Ecuador. The match kicks off at 5 p.m. Eastern and will be broadcast on FS1.
Several streaming services will broadcast Saturday’s match live, and you can watch DIRECTV (free trial), as well as on FuboTV (promotional offer) and Sling (promotional offers).
Brazil has won eight of the nine Copa America Femenina tournaments, including the most recent one in 2022 when it defeated Colombia in the final, 1-0, on Colombian soil. This will also be just the fourth championship match in the history of the tournament with the other five being decided by two rounds of group play and the winner clinching an automatic spot in the FIFA Women’s World Cup.
Colombia needed a penalty shootout to defeat Argentina in the semifinals on Monday. They secured the win in the shootout, 5-4, when Eliana Stábile of Argentina, who needed to score to extend the shootout, struck the post.
Brazil had no issues in its semifinal match on Tuesday when it routed Uruguay, 5-1. Four different players scored for Brazil, including Amanda Gutierres’ two goals.
The tournament has not been without controversy. Brazilian players, including Marta, recently criticized CONMEBOL and tournament organizers for requiring teams to warm up in confined indoor areas rather than on the pitch. Following this criticism, CONMEBOL announced adjustments to pre-match procedures, allowing players to warm up on the pitch.
A look at Colombia
Colombia has been the runner-up of Copa America Fememina three times since joining the competition in 1998, coming in second to Brazil all three times. The 1-0 loss in 2022 was the only time the two teams played in a final, with Brazil’s championships in 2010 and 2014 coming in a final stage round robin.
Colombia was the only team in the group stage that Brazil failed to beat when it held the fellow South American squad to a 0-0 draw on July 25.
The two teams shared the same totals for goals scored (12), goals allowed (1) and goal differential (plus-11) in the group stage.
In addition to its 0-0 draw vs. Brazil, Colombia earned victories of 8-0 vs. Bolivia and 4-1 vs. Paraguay along with a 0-0 tie vs. Venezuela to earn a spot in the knockout stage.
Colombia players to watch
Linda Caicedo, who plays club football for Real Madrid, has 3 goals in five appearances to lead Colombia in scoring.
Mayra Ramírez has been equally influential with three assists, tied with Marta of Brazil for the most in the tournament. Ramirez, who plays for Chelsea in England, also has two goals along with Daniela Montoya.
Katherine Tapia has been Colombia’s goalkeeper for all five matches of the tournament, and she has kept four clean sheets. She has made 14 saves during Copa America Femenina.
A look at Brazil
The eight-time Copa America Femenina champions are well poised to bring home championship No. 9 on Saturday. Despite finishing behind Argentina (12) in terms of overall points in the group stage with 10, Brazil’s 0-0 draw vs. Colombia on July 25 has been the only blemish they have had in this tournament.
They opened their tournament with a 2-0 win vs. Venezuela, and then added victories of 6-0 vs. Bolivia and 4-1 vs. Paraguay.
As a team, they have scored 17 goals in the tournament, five more than Colombia.
Brazil and Colombia met three times in 2024, with Brazil winning twice and drawing with them in the other match.
Brazil players to watch
Amanda Gutierres is the leading scorer in the tournament with five goals in four matches. Two of her goals came in the semifinal win vs. Uruguay on Tuesday, and she has scored in every match she has appeared in during the tournament.
Kerolin is second on the team in scoring in this tournament with three, followed by Luany, Duda Sampaio and Yasmim all tied for third with two each.
The legendary Marta, who plays for Orlando Pride in the NWSL, has three assists in the tournament and also scored vs. Uruguay.
